colti:
Technical operations projects series ; no.
            TO 244

abstracts.cdata!:
This report reviews, and evaluates the
            technical feasibility of irrigation in Sudan, namely as it
            regards the implementation of the Managil, and Roseires
            Projects. Regarding the Managil Project, based on the
            capital cost of construction through stages 1 and 2, and the
            estimated cost of completion of stages 3 and 4, the direct
            return on invested capital is at about nine percent, plus a
            further 3.4 percent from cotton export duty. It is
            recommended that priority be given to completion of stages 3
            and 4, and that the Gezira Board be responsible for
            technical advice, and supervision of the production of other
            crops as well as cotton. As for the Roseires Project, it is
            recommended that sedimentation in particular, be considered,
            and, that the spillway design, and the proposed provision
            for future power requires further study. Subject to adequate
            arrangements regarding the use of the Nile waters, and
            further sedimentation studies, the project is a sound
            investment, though should proceed when financial resources
            become available.
